deecbb50-60c6-4f65-a7f7-4adac18f906e.description: Earners have comprehensive knowledge and expertise in the Standards of Good Practice in Education Abroad and Code of Ethics. They are able to use the Standards to assess and improve education abroad operations and practices. They are knowledgeable of best practices, where to find resources to support their work, and can communicate the importance of the Standards to stakeholders. Earners must contribute to the field through various professional activities to maintain their certification.
deecbb50-60c6-4f65-a7f7-4adac18f906e.name: Professional Certification in Education Abroad

issuer.summary: issued by The Forum on Education Abroad

alignments.name: Standards of Good Practice for Education Abroad
alignments.description: The Forum on Education Abroad is a 501(c) (3) non-profit organization recognized by the U.S. Department of Justice and the Federal Trade Commission as the Standards Development Organization for Education Abroad. The Forum develops and disseminates comprehensive Standards of Good Practice for the field of education abroad.

badge_template_activities.title: Attend six four-hour workshops: Overview of the Standards of Good Practice; Mission, Ethics and Integrity (Standards 1, 9 and The Code of Ethics); Student Selection, Preparation, Code of Conduct and Returning Support (Standards 4 and 5); Health, Safety, Security and Risk Management (Standard 8);  Student Learning, Development and Academic Framework (Standards 2 and 3) and Program Resources, Policies and Procedures (Standards 6 and 7)

Complete 11 assignments to assess the candidate's ability to articulate and apply the Standards; identify areas of risk and appropriately respond to crises; develop policies and procedures to improve student preparation for study abroad; draft and implement policies that are fair, ethical and transparent; appropriately respond to student conduct issues; provide guidance to stakeholders (faculty, staff, administration) on the Standards and assess operations based on these Standards.

Complete a Culminating Project: Drawing upon the nine Standards of Good Practice and associated queries, and the Code of Ethics, Certified Professionals have completed a position paper to address up to three challenges and have described in detail deliverables (e.g., training, handbooks, policy statements) to address these challenges. They have identified appropriate resources to support their recommendations.

Assignments meet established rubrics as determined by two Forum Certified Assessors, professionals in the field with senior level experience and in depth knowledge of the Standards of Good Practice. Participants resubmit assignments to incorporate feedback from the assessors until the assignment meets the competency requirement.

def3cd81-50d1-4e35-838b-d5b565918761.description: Earners are able to articulate the Standards of Good Practice in Education Abroad and apply them in various contexts. They are competent in using the Standards and the Code of Ethics to guide their professional work, are knowledgeable of best practices, and know where to find resources to support their work. They are competent in communicating the importance of the Standards and Code of Ethics to various stakeholders and assessing education abroad operations based on these Standards.
